intro: Urobotrya gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in woodland areas. Urobotrya gabonensis is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences.
